Event.name: Intentionally_act
Event.definition:
<def-root>This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings. It exists mostly for FE inheritance.
<ex><fex name="Agent">I</fex> <t>carried</t> <t>out</t> <fex name="Act">the deed</fex> <fex name="Manner">easily</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Act
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.</def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
<ex><fex name="Agent">We</fex> have not yet <t>acted</t> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an Agent performs an intentional act. John <t>flattered</t> her <fex name="Purpose">to receive a raise</fex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the Means by which an Agent acts intentionally.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). <ex>'Twould be best it were <t>done</t> <fex name="Manner">quietly</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Domain
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Domain</fen> within which the <fen>Agent</fen> acts.
<ex>No doubt he has begun to engage in <fex name="dom">political</fex> <t>activity</t> of late</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Frequency</fen> with which the <fen>Agent</fen> does the <fen>Act</fen> in a given period of time.</def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the state of affairs expressed by the target, but not in all cases. </def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE gives a description of the Intentionally_act event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Apparent_conclusion
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE describes an additional situation or modification that would seem to hold given the rest of the situation. In some cases, it marks a completely separate conclusion than one would draw from the manner of the event in the main clause. As far as we know, this idea is only explicitly marked in English with "as if".
<ex>We have to <t>do</t> our duty <fex name="Apparent_conclusion">as if it matters</fex> .</ex>
Usually, the <fen>Apparent_conclusion</fen> contains another FE, either peripheral or extra-thematic, which is non-factive (i.e., it may, but does not necessarily, hold). For these cases, we annotate the other frame-element on the second layer; thus the following should be annotated with <fen>Purpose</fen> on the second layer.
<ex><fex name="Apparent_conclusion">As if to guarantee failure</fex> , they <t>conducted</t> the study without consulting experts .</ex> <ex>As if <fex name="Purpose">to guarantee failure</fex> , they <t>conducted</t> the study without consulting experts .</ex>
We do not annotate this FE in cases where we merely infer that a part of the sentence is meant sarcastically, as in the following minimal modification of the above sentence:
<ex>To guarantee failure , they <t>conducted</t> the study without consulting experts .</ex>
In this case, we simply annotate the <fen>Purpose</fen> FE.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: do.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: perform or carry out (an action).

lexUnit.name: step.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a measure or action, especially one of a series taken in order to deal with or achieve a particular thing.

lexUnit.name: act.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take action; do something FN: [Usage: normally used only when the Act is implied.]

lexUnit.name: activity.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an action taken in pursuit of an objective

lexUnit.name: perform.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: carry out, accomplish, or fulfil (an action, task, or function).

lexUnit.name: carry out.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: perform (a task or planned operation).

lexUnit.name: execute.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: carry out or put into effect (a plan, order, etc.).

lexUnit.name: engage.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: participate or become involved in.

lexUnit.name: measures.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a means of achieving a purpose

lexUnit.name: move.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an act embedded with strategy

lexUnit.name: actor.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the person deliberately involved in an event or activity

lexUnit.name: agent.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A person who acts of his own volition
